title: How to Thoroughly Clean a Bedroom

steps.headline: Pick up everything that's on the floor and put it on your bed, so you won't be tempted to stop cleaning and sleep.
Sort out everything else in your room.
steps.description: This includes the things on your bed, things under your bed, things from the wardrobe and everything in storage in your room. Make 5 separate piles: keep, throw away, storage, give away, and not sure. Sort out everything into these piles.

steps.headline: Get a bin liner and throw out everything from the 'throw away' pile.
Get a bag for the 'give away' pile.
steps.description: Make sure nothing in this pile is broken, and check to see if there's anything someone you know could have, then put all these items into the bag. Take it to a charity later.

steps.headline: Go through all the 'not sure' objects.
steps.description: Think whether you really need to keep them. If they have no functional use and you don't really want them on show, yet are of sentimental value then put it in the 'storage' pile. A good way to test whether you really need something is checking if the last time you used or looked at something was in the past few months. If it wasn't, then you probably don't need it.

steps.headline: You should have 2 piles left - keep and storage.
steps.description: Hopefully the room is starting to look tidier now you've sorted things out. The storage things go.. you guessed it, into storage. This could be a basement, garage, attic, or storage boxes in your room. Put all these things away.

steps.headline: Before you put the 'keep' items back into their places, it's time to clean.
steps.description: Dust, wipe, and wash all surfaces in your room, including doors, light switches and windows. Vacuum your room, and take any cups or plates out of your room. Don't skip the hard to reach / under the bed / in the corner spots. Move small pieces of furniture so you can reach everywhere. Then clean each "keep" item thoroughly, either in bucket filled with hot water and dish soap or with rags and plenty of disinfecting cleaner.

steps.headline: Put the 'keep' items back in their places in the room only after you have cleaned them.
steps.description: Your room should now be fully clean and tidy.

methods.name: If You Have a Wardrobe That Needs Cleaning

steps.headline: Go through all your clothes, and sort into 3 piles - Keep, give away, and throw out.
steps.description: Only throw out if the clothes are underwear, swimsuits, have holes in, etc.

steps.headline: Take everything out of your wardrobe and put in your room.
steps.description: Wipe down the inside of the wardrobe and maybe vacuum if you're lucky enough to have a walk-in wardrobe.

steps.headline: Hang or fold your clothes back in the wardrobe.

text: Bedroom Pick up everything that's on the floor and put it on your bed, so you won't be tempted to stop cleaning and sleep.  Sort out everything else in your room. This includes the things on your bed, things under your bed, things from the wardrobe and everything in storage in your room. Make 5 separate piles: keep, throw away, storage, give away, and not sure. Sort out everything into these piles. Get a bin liner and throw out everything from the 'throw away' pile. Also, empty the trash can. Get a bag for the 'give away' pile. Make sure nothing in this pile is broken, and check to see if there's anything someone you know could have, then put all these items into the bag. Take it to a charity later. Go through all the 'not sure' objects. Think whether you really need to keep them. If they have no functional use and you don't really want them on show, yet are of sentimental value then put it in the 'storage' pile. A good way to test whether you really need something is checking if the last time you used or looked at something was in the past few months. If it wasn't, then you probably don't need it. You should have 2 piles left - keep and storage. Hopefully the room is starting to look tidier now you've sorted things out. The storage things go.. you guessed it, into storage. This could be a basement, garage, attic, or storage boxes in your room. Put all these things away. Before you put the 'keep' items back into their places, it's time to clean. Dust, wipe, and wash all surfaces in your room, including doors, light switches and windows. Vacuum your room, and take any cups or plates out of your room. Don't skip the hard to reach / under the bed / in the corner spots. Move small pieces of furniture so you can reach everywhere. Then clean each "keep" item thoroughly, either in bucket filled with hot water and dish soap or with rags and plenty of disinfecting cleaner. Put the 'keep' items back in their places in the room only after you have cleaned them. Your room should now be fully clean and tidy. If You Have a Wardrobe That Needs Cleaning Go through all your clothes, and sort into 3 piles - Keep, give away, and throw out. Only throw out if the clothes are underwear, swimsuits, have holes in, etc. Take everything out of your wardrobe and put in your room. Wipe down the inside of the wardrobe and maybe vacuum if you're lucky enough to have a walk-in wardrobe. Hang or fold your clothes back in the wardrobe.
